api.body:
-- Get selected timelines (returns a table)
local selectedTimelines = Pixera.Timelines.getTimelinesSelected()

-- Ensure at least one timeline is selected
if #selectedTimelines == 0 then
    pixc.log("No selected timelines found!")
    return
end

-- Extract the first selected timeline
local timeline = selectedTimelines[1]

-- Get the timeline name
local timelineName = timeline.getName()

-- Get the timeline FPS
local fps = timeline.getFps()

-- Get the current time of the selected timeline
local currentTime = timeline.getCurrentTime()

-- Add 1 second worth of frames to currentTime
local newTime = currentTime + fps

-- Log everything before setting new time
pixc.log("Selected Timeline Name: " .. timelineName)
pixc.log("Current Time (Frames): " .. tostring(currentTime))
pixc.log("New Time After Adding 1 Second (Frames): " .. tostring(newTime))

-- Apply the new time using correct dot notation
timeline.setCurrentTime(newTime)

-- Log final state
pixc.log("Timeline '" .. timelineName .. "' has been moved to frame: " .. tostring(timeline.getCurrentTime()))
api.name: forward1Second

api.body:
-- Get selected timelines (returns a table)
local selectedTimelines = Pixera.Timelines.getTimelinesSelected()

-- Ensure at least one timeline is selected
if #selectedTimelines == 0 then
    pixc.log("No selected timelines found!")
    return
end

-- Extract the first selected timeline
local timeline = selectedTimelines[1]

-- Get the timeline name
local timelineName = timeline.getName()

-- Get the timeline FPS
local fps = timeline.getFps()

-- Get the current time of the selected timeline
local currentTime = timeline.getCurrentTime()

-- Add 1 second worth of frames to currentTime
local newTime = currentTime - fps

-- Log everything before setting new time
pixc.log("Selected Timeline Name: " .. timelineName)
pixc.log("Current Time (Frames): " .. tostring(currentTime))
pixc.log("New Time After Adding 1 Second (Frames): " .. tostring(newTime))

-- Apply the new time using correct dot notation
timeline.setCurrentTime(newTime)

-- Log final state
pixc.log("Timeline '" .. timelineName .. "' has been moved to frame: " .. tostring(timeline.getCurrentTime()))
api.name: back1Second
